result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Helton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber granted for work and any counseling Defendant may be involved in. First 60 in jail, second 60 can be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment. - Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay fines, costs, and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: letter from FCC dated 02/01/16 in re:  restitution hearing scheduled
Restitution Hearing - Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law and Judgment /s/ DJW 03/11/16 and /s/ TTF 03/11/16

Defendant Patrick J. Helton in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson.  Victim Witness Coordinator, Jane Iwanski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:59 a.m.   Restitution Hearing held at this time.   Court calls case.  Ms. Iwanski states their appearances.  Court states the Defendant's appearances.  Mary Hesch is called, sworn by the Court, and gives testimony regarding the restitution requested.   Cross examination by Atty Halverson.  

Atty Halverson makes statements regarding her representing the Defendant only on the criminal matter, and is unable to represent him on any civil matter.  Atty Halverson makes statements regarding receiving different restitution amounts, and no third party was present when items was taken from the home.   Atty Halverson is prepared to address the items listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Ms. Iwanski makes statements regarding the restitution that was requested with the restitution summary.  Atty Halvorsen states the different restituion amounts that she has received.  Further discussions.

BTC:  Court will make a written recommendation to Judge Flugaur, who will make a final determination.  Parties to receive copies of the written recommendation.

Hrg Concludes at 10:27 a.m.
Referral to Court Commission for Restitution Hearing

Defendant Patrick J. Helton in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:36 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter was set for a jury trial today. Court was advised matter has been resolved.

Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
Count 2 and Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.
Defense will be asking for a restitution hearing.

Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Atty Halverson agrees Defendant qualifies for repeater status.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim impact statement has been given to the Court and a copy given to Defense.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests a restitution hearing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, Court will adopt the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work and any counseling Defendant may be involved in
First 60 in jail, second 60 can be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $50 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent
Restitution to be paid, to be determined after restitution hearing.

Family Court Commissioner will hear the restitution hearing.

Court signs order for hearing.

20 days in which to appeal the case.

No to go on the premises of Slumberland in Stevens Point 
NO contact unless it's incidental with its employees.

Defendant Patrick J. Helton in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court re: no contact request.
Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
